head.supplied: 18/6/69 ¶ ¶ Not having heard of you, dear Mr Fitzgibbon, allow me to ask, whether the stones are all safe. ¶ ¶ If not, I must make an other effort to secure them all. Really I spent too much labor o...

div.p: Unit 733, VPRS 3181/P Town Clerk's file series 1, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
Not having heard of you, dear Mr Fitzgibbon, allow me to ask, whether the stones are all safe.
See M to E. FitzGibbon, 13 June 1869. See also E. FitzGibbon to M, 25 June 1869.
If not, I must make an other effort to secure them all. Really I spent too much labor on them to incur the loss.
